summary.para: The get_AvailableTVFormats method retrieves the analog video formats that the decoder supports.

param.name: lAnalogVideoStandard
param.para: Pointer to a variable that receives a bitwise enumeration.

returns.para: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

summary.para: The get_HorizontalLocked method determines whether the horizontal sync is locked.

param.name: plLocked
param.para: Pointer to a variable that receives one of the following values.

returns.para: Returns an HRESULT value. Possible values include the following.

description.para: The device does not support this method.

summary.para: The get_NumberOfLInes method retrieves the number of scan lines in the video signal.

param.name: plNumberOfLines
param.para: Pointer to a variable that receives the number of scan lines in the video signal. This is generally by 525 lines for NTSC and 625 lines for PAL or SECAM.

returns.para: Returns an HRESULT value. Possible values include the following.

description.para: The device does not support this method.

summary.para: The get_OutputEnable method determines whether the video port bus is enabled.

param.name: plOutputEnable
param.para: Pointer to a variable that receives one of the following values.

returns.para: Returns an HRESULT value. Possible values include the following.

description.para: The device does not support this method.

remarks.para: This method applies only to devices that use a shared video port bus. If the returned value is 1, the device is actively driving the video port bus. If the value is zero, the device is tri-stated.

summary.para: The get_TVFormat method retrieves the current analog video format.

param.name: plAnalogVideoStandard
param.para: Pointer to a variable that receives a member of the enumeration, indicating the analog video format.

returns.para: Returns S_OK if successful, or an error code otherwise.

summary.para: The get_VCRHorizontalLocking method indicates whether the decoder is expecting video from a tape source or a broadcast source.

param.name: plVCRHorizontalLocking
param.para: Pointer to a variable that receives one of the following values.

item.description: The decoder is expecting video from a broadcast source.
The decoder is expecting video from a tape source.

returns.para: Returns an HRESULT value. Possible values include the following.

description.para: The device does not support this method.

remarks.para: The timing accuracy of synchronization pulses is typically poorer from a tape source than from a broadcast source. If the returned value is 1, the decoder might relax its sync timing standards.

summary.para: The put_OutputEnable method enables or disables the video port bus.

param.name: lOutputEnable
param.para: Specifies whether the bus is enabled. Use one of the following values.

returns.para: Returns an HRESULT value. Possible values include the following.

description.para: The device does not support this method.

remarks.para: This method applies only to devices that use a shared video port bus. If the value is 1, the device will actively drive the video port bus. If the value is zero, the device will be tri-stated.

summary.para: The put_TVFormat method sets the analog video format.

param.name: lAnalogVideoStandard
param.para: Specifies the video format as a member of the enumeration.

returns.para: Returns S_OK if successful, or an error code otherwise.

summary.para: The put_VCRHorizontalLocking method specifies whether the video is a tape source or a broadcast source.

param.name: lVCRHorizontalLocking
param.para: Specifies one of the following values.

item.description: The video is from a broadcast source.
The video is from a tape source.

returns.para: Returns an HRESULT value. Possible values include the following.

description.para: The device does not support this method.

remarks.para: The timing accuracy of synchronization pulses is typically poorer from a tape source than from a broadcast source. Setting the value to 1 tells the decoder to relax its standards, which leads to a better chance of maintaining sync.

summary.para: The IAMAnalogVideoDecoder interface sets and retrieves information about the analog-to-digital conversion process in a video capture filter.

The WDM Video Capture filter exposes this interface if the device is an analog video capture device. Applications can use this interface to control aspects of the analog decoding process, such as the analog video format and the horizontal sync lock.

remarks.para: For Windows Driver Model (WDM) devices, the WDM Video Capture Filter automatically exposes this interface if the WDM driver supports the PROPSETID_VIDCAP_VIDEODECODER property set. For more information, see the Windows Driver Kit (WDK) documentation.
